DataElement.preferredName: Cytarabine  Less Than or Equal To Integer::2  Gram per Square Meter per Day Administered Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: An antimetabolite analogue of cytidine with a modified sugar moiety (arabinose instead of ribose). Cytarabine is converted to the triphosphate form within the cell and then competes with cytidine for incorporation into DNA.  Because the arabinose sugar sterically hinders the rotation of the molecule within DNA, DNA replication ceases, specifically during the S phase of the cell cycle.  This agent also inhibits DNA polymerase, resulting in a decrease in DNA replication and repair. (NCI04)_A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest is smaller than the other object in one of these ways._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::2_Dose of drug administered per day expressed as grams per square meter of body surface area (BSA)._The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test)._Indicator of Yes, No, Unknown, Not Done, or Not Applicable to a question.[manually curated]

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An anticancer drug that belongs to the family of drugs called antimetabolites.

Concepts.definition: An antimetabolite analogue of cytidine with a modified sugar moiety (arabinose instead of ribose). Cytarabine is converted to the triphosphate form within the cell and then competes with cytidine for incorporation into DNA.  Because the arabinose sugar sterically hinders the rotation of the molecule within DNA, DNA replication ceases, specifically during the S phase of the cell cycle.  This agent also inhibits DNA polymerase, resulting in a decrease in DNA replication and repair. (NCI04)
